column4: Hi. Do you recommend using the 64bit version of Ubuntu? Do I have access tho all apps in 32bit version?
there may be some minor compatibility issues, but almost everything in the 32-bit version works in the 64-bit version
kde uses qt for widgets while gnome and xfce use gtk
there is also wine for some windoes apps
virtualbox and other virtual machines require a windows license and an installation of windows irself
what do you mean? can't i use virtual inside ubuntu and install windows?
and i can use a cracked iso of win, can i?
you should only use a legal copy with a legal license
we do not advocate or allow piracy here
even if it is a product by microsoft
what is my alternative? i do have a laptop with vista with licence. can i put that licence on the pc and ubuntu on laptop?
maybe sed, but I'm probably wrong
